IPath2

Defines a 2D Path (collection of bezier curves and lines)

Functions
GetNumerElems

Returns the number of PathElems in the path

Returns

Number of PathElems comprising the path

GetPathElem

Returns the Ith path element in the path

Returns

Pointer to the Ith path element

GetBBox
virtual BBox2 GetBBox() = 0

Returns the path's bounding box. The path's bounding box includes the convex hull of any curves. For a tighter fit first flatten the path via [IPath2::Flatten].

Returns

Path's bounding box

AddPathElem
virtual void AddPathElem(
EPathElem 
elemType,
Vector2* 
p0
= 
nullptr,
Vector2* 
p1
= 
nullptr,
Vector2* 
p2
= 
nullptr
) = 0

Ads a new path element to the end of the path

Parameters
elemType
EPathElem

type of element to add

p0-p3

points to use. These are dependent on the type of element requested via 'elemType'

AppendPathElems
virtual void AppendPathElems(
EPathElem 
elemType,
...
) = 0

Appends a series of new path elements to the end of the path

Parameters
elemType
EPathElem

type of element to add

...

varargs of elemType, x, y, ..., elemType, x, y, ...  Each vararg elemType is expected to be followed by the correct number of x,y coordinate pairs for the specified element type.  For instance the following call is valid: AppendPathElem(EPathElem::MoveTo, 0.0f, 0.0f, EPathElem::CurveTo, 0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 2.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f, 3.0f, EPathElem::ClosePath, EPathElem::Null);

Flatten
virtual CRefObj<IPath2> Flatten(
float 
flatness,
BBox2* 
bb
= 
nullptr
) = 0

Flattens the path. This results in a path that only contains line segments

Parameters
flatness
float

tolerance for what is considered flat

bbox

returns the new path's bounding box

Returns

Pointer to the Ith path element

PointOnPath
virtual bool PointOnPath(
Vector2& 
pt,
Vector2 * 
closestpt,
float 
tolerance
) = 0

Determines whether a 2D point lies on the path (within some tolerance)

Parameters
pt
Vector2&

Point to test

closestpt
Vector2*

returns the closest point

tolerance
float

tolerance

Returns

True if point is on path with given tolerance. False otherwise.

PathInsideBbox
virtual bool PathInsideBbox(
BBox2& 
bbox
) = 0

Determines whether the path lies within the specified bounding box.

Parameters
bbox
BBox2&

bounding box to test if path is inside of

Returns

True if path is inside specified bounding box. False otherwise.
